cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 325°F.
In a Dutch oven, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp.
Remove the bacon from the pot and set aside.
Brown chicken in the remaining bacon fat.
Add the mushrooms and onions, and sauté until softened.
Pour in the wine, add the bacon back to the pot, and cover.
Bake in the oven for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
Slice the eggplant, zucchini, and yellow squash into rounds.
Slice the tomatoes and onion into thin wedges.
Layer the vegetables in a baking dish, starting with the eggplant.
Drizzle olive oil over the vegetables and season with salt and pepper.
Bake in a preheated oven at 375°F for 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 325°F.
Cook the bacon in a Dutch oven over medium heat until crisp.
Remove the bacon from the pot and set aside.
Brown the beef in the remaining bacon fat.
Add the carrots and onions, and sauté until softened.
Pour in the wine, add the bacon back to the pot, and cover.
Bake in the oven for 2 1/2 to 3 hours.
Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Cook the bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crisp.
Drain the bacon and crumble it.
Roll out the pie crust and fit it into a 9-inch pie dish.
Sprinkle the bacon and cheese over the bottom of the crust.
Whisk together the eggs and cream, and pour the mixture over the bacon and cheese.
